text:
Hi <@UDEASNWEB>,
I have checked the greenhouse APIs and these are simple enough to use them. You can find it out here: <https://developers.greenhouse.io/>
To connect it with HubSpot should not be an issue if you want to connect it with a middleware application.
You can create a middleware application which can sync both of the system accordingly.

It seems there’s an inline style on the input field for a password page, generated with the following HubL `{% password_prompt "my_password_prompt" label="My Password Prompt", bad_password_message="<p>Sorry, please try again.</p>", submit_button_text="Submit", password_placeholder="Password" %}`

The output is: `<input name="password" type="password" placeholder="Password" id="hs-pwd-widget-password" style="height: 22px; margin-top: -5px">`

I know I can override this  with `!important` , however I don’t want to do that. Is it possible to add a parameter which removes this inline style? The <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/tags#password-prompt|reference> says nothing.
Thanks, I’m familiar with the documentation. I guess I wasn’t clear, I’m looking for anything unexpected that others may have found during the integration.
ah sorry misunderstood you. I didn't use this API but shouldn't be any issue.
Wondering what the protocol is for redirects when replacing an existing domain on a HubSpot site.

Know of any way to identify the hard returns in a contact fields?

ie:
This
is
how
Text
Should
Show

How it shows: ThisishowTextShouldShow
is there an easy way to export a listing of everything published in a HubSpot portal?  Landing page, Website Pages, and blogs with their urls and page names?

Should be able to pull what you need using these APIs:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/pages/get_pages>
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/blogv2/get_blog_posts>

If you need the actual blog listing pages as well:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/blogv2/get_blogs>

Has anyone ever gotten images served up from `<https://f.HubSpotusercontent20.net/hubfs/[portal-id]/[image-name].jpg>`??? I handed a site off to a client, they input the images, and now all images are all showing up from that address.
The `resize_image_url` function isn’t working on these images.
